channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Branches from tree in garden of no 6 overhanging the pavement, 12th September
item.description:
The branches overhang the pavement outside no 6 meaning you have to stoop to get past or otherwise leave the pavement. It has been like this for at least 1 month.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highfield Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4th report, 12th September
item.description:
8149135.plse see report closed today - so 3pm the flytip has been cleared, but at 6.30pm, guess what , it's still there! what is the problem here?

item.title: Brand new fancy brickwork of the £169,000 redesigned Chinese Roundabout damaged. About three bricks knocked askew. Jct of Wickham Rd and Stone Park Avenue, Beckenham., 12th September
item.description:
Brand new fancy brickwork of the £169,000 redesigned Chinese Roundabout damaged. About three bricks knocked askew. Jct of Wickham Rd and Stone Park Avenue, Beckenham. Incidentally, what was once an attractive roundabout looks now, with the black and white chevrons all around it, like something from a motor racing circuit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chinese Roundabout, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped mattress and household waste, 12th September
item.description:
The people who dump their rubbish here have days after the black bags were cleared up dumped some more rubbish on the mattress that has been there for 2 weeks. Maybe the council can put up a sign saying don't put your rubbish here so the residents doing so will stop as it does not appear to be willing to investigate or do anything else

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drummond Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 12th September
item.description:
It looks like someone has booked a pick up for the dishwasher. But someone else has fly tipped some blinds and flammable liquid. It's outside our building and it's been here since this morning.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gloucester Drive, Hackney, London

item.title: Abandoned road traffic cone, 12th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lane Side, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Weeds have not been cleared for months, 12th September
item.description:
Weeds are growing along the mews which is a public highway. The street cleaners used to clear them but haven’t done so for months. Owner occupiers clear outside their homes but outside rental properties and the gates to Chelwood are a mess.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Radnor Mews, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 bins overflowing outside Tesco Express (this is a regular occurrence), 12th September
item.description:
The bins are very often full and overflowing with litter, which not only looks untidy, but is also attractive for rodents. Maybe more regular bin cleaning is required.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Stone Park Avenue, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes left in parking bays, 12th September
item.description:
We are seeing Lime bikes being continuously left in the parking bay instead of the bike rack next to the bays. Can you please get these removed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hoxton Street, Shoreditch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike frames outside Homerton Station, 12th September
item.description:
Abandoned bikes and bike wheel outside Homerton Station. Taking up spaces and creating a litter trap. Please remove.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barnabas Road, London
